title: Photos: Former San Francisco 49ers quarterback Alex Smith selling Monte Sereno mansion
content:
Ex-49ers QB Alex Smith has listed his French Villa-style home in Monte Sereno, Calif. for $3.999 million. 
  
Smith, who now plays for the Kansas City Chiefs, was the 49ers' play-caller from 2005 to 2012. 
  
His 4,650 square foot property built in 2010 touts four bedrooms and four-and-a-half baths. It features 100-year-old reclaimed white oak wood interior beams, French imported antique limestone floors, radiant heated floors, a professional bocce ball court, among many other amenities. 
  
Smith bought the home in 2011 for $3,627,500, according to public records. The current listing agent for the property is Cherish Atkinson with the Sereno Group.
